poem:
Title: "In a Receptive Democracy"

Amidst the churn of opinions,
ripe fruit in the market - 
Old Biden, Agile Trump. 
A dance in the ink - 
where words breed anger, 
breed truth, breed deception. 
Whose truth? 
Distant echoes - The Times in the henhouse, 
shadows play on rustic walls. 
O democracy, fickle and fluid as spring rain, 
We are all drunk on ink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Democrats are angry over media coverage of Biden. Is it a distraction? When an opinion poll in the New York Times found that a majority of Joe Biden’s voters believe he is too old to be an effective US president, the call to action was swift. But it was not aimed at Joe Biden. “Amplifying flawed presidential polls, refusing to report on [Donald] Trump’s cognitive issues, the NYT is biased for Trump,” was a sample". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Democrats are angry over media coverage of Biden. Is it a distraction? But it was not aimed at Joe Biden. “Amplifying flawed presidential polls, refusing to report on [Donald] Trump’s cognitive issues, the NYT is biased for Trump,” was a sample
